description.summary: A pale humanoid creature that originated as 2005 creepypasta fiction but evolved into claimed real experiences. Described as emaciated, crawling on all fours, with pale skin and hollow eyes.
description.full: The Rake is an internet-born creepypasta character that first appeared in 2005-2006 on the /b/ board of 4chan as a collaborative fiction project. Described as a pale, emaciated humanoid creature that crawls on all fours, has hollow or sunken eyes, and appears in bedrooms at night, the Rake was explicitly created as fiction. However, like Slenderman, the character evolved beyond its fictional origins, with some people in the 2010s claiming genuine encounters. The Rake represents a fascinating example of modern digital folklore where fictional creation leads to belief reports, blurring lines between entertainment and perceived reality. It is related to sleep paralysis experiences and demonstrates how internet culture creates new mythological entities.

etymology.origin: Created on 4chan's /b/ board as collaborative creepypasta
etymology.meaning: 'Rake' refers to its thin, rake-like appearance or possibly 'raking' scratches

features.description: Crawls on all fours like an animal

abilities.description: Appears in victims' bedrooms at night
Associated with scratching or scraping noises

range.description: Internet-born, claimed experiences primarily in North America and English-speaking countries

origins.cultural_roots: Created on 4chan in 2005-2006 as collaborative fiction

timeline.significance: Some people begin claiming real encounters
Studied as example of digital folklore creation

factual.name: Entirely Fictional
factual.description: Created as fiction, all 'sightings' are either fictional reports, sleep paralysis, or psychological

psychological.name: Sleep Paralysis
psychological.description: Experiences attributed to Rake are sleep paralysis episodes influenced by Rake imagery

psychological.name: Mass Suggestion
psychological.description: Exposure to Rake stories causes suggestible individuals to interpret experiences as Rake encounters

folklore.significance: Example of modern digital folklore creation
folklore.evolution: Shows how internet culture creates new mythological entities

popular_culture.significance: Part of broader creepypasta phenomenon alongside Slenderman, Jeff the Killer, etc.

research.academic_interest: Studied by folklorists and digital culture researchers as example of internet folklore evolution
research.ongoing_studies: Analysis of fiction-to-belief phenomenon in digital age

sources.title: Folklore, Horror Stories, and the Slender Man
